metadata.title: CVE-2019-17023 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
After a HelloRetryRequest has been sent, the client may negotiate a lowerprotocol that TLS 1.3, resulting in an invalid state transition in the TLSState Machine. If the client gets into this state, incoming ApplicationData records will be ignored. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 72.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
nss package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1').
